Whether for businesses or individuals, our solutions enhance customer engagement, create lasting impressions, and elevate brand perception like never before.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Production / Back Office Executive

Reporting Lines: Will work with and report directly to CEO

Role Description


	This is a full-time hybrid role for a Production/Back Office Executive based in Lagos with some work from home flexibility. The Production/Back Office Executive will be responsible for day-to-day production planning, quality control, production management, and staff training.
	The role involves effective communication with the team and ensuring that all produced items meet the set quality standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure all operations are carried on in an appropriate, cost-effective way
	Improve operational management systems, processes and best practices
	Purchase materials, label materials plan inventory and oversee warehouse efficiency
	Help the organisation’s processes remain legally compliant
	Formulate strategic and operational objectives
	Examine financial data and use them to improve profitability
	Manage internal budgets and forecasts
	Perform quality controls and monitor production KPIs
	Monthly Stock Inventory Audit and weekly reports to Management
	Find ways to increase quality of products
	Support day-to-day store operation
	Evaluate store and individual performances
	Report on regional sales results
	Forecast quarterly and annual profits
	Prepare and review the annual budget for the area of responsibility

	Suggest and implement new services/products and innovative sales techniques to increase customer satisfaction
	Conduct market research to identify selling possibilities and evaluate customer needs
	Set up meetings with potential clients and listen to their wishes and concerns
	Packaging and delivery of client order(s)
	Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on products and services
	Applicants should preferably reside on the island.


Qualifications


	Passion for fragrance
	Experience in production and operations
	Understanding of the production processes.
	A commitment to excellent customer service.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Superb interpersonal skills, including the ability to quickly build rapport with Team
	Experience using computers for a variety of tasks.

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

	The Senior Accountant will play a critical role in managing the company&rsquo;s financial health by ensuring sound accounting practices, accurate reporting, and compliance with statutory regulations.
	The ideal candidate will oversee all accounting operations, from financial analysis and reporting to budgeting,&nbsp;inventory control, and tax management.
	Given the company&rsquo;s involvement in the sales and distribution of technological communication products, the Senior Accountant will also manage vendor reconciliations, track cost of goods sold, monitor cash flow from sales channels, and provide strategic insights to support management decisions.
	This role requires a high degree of accuracy, analytical skill, and integrity to ensure financial transparency and business growth.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Accounting &amp; Reporting:


	Prepare and maintain accurate and up-to-date financial statements and records.
	Oversee the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual management reports.
	Ensure compliance with FIRS &amp; LIRS and other relevant accounting standards.
	Conduct regular reconciliation of bank accounts, vendor accounts, and inventory balances.
	Manage fixed asset records and depreciation schedules.


Budgeting &amp; Financial Planning:


	Lead the annual budgeting and forecasting process, ensuring alignment with business goals.
	Analyze actual performance against budgets and forecasts, identifying variances and recommendingcorrective actions.
	Develop financial models and projections to support strategic business planning.


Taxation &amp; Regulatory Compliance:


	Ensure accurate and timely filing of all statutory obligations including VAT, PAYE, WHT, Pension, and Company Income Tax in compliance with FIRS and LIRS regulations.
	Manage relationships with external auditors, tax authorities, and consultants to ensure compliance
	and audit readiness.
	Maintain proper documentation for tax audits and financial reviews.


Inventory, Cost &amp; Sales Accounting:


	Oversee accurate valuation of inventory.
	Track cost of goods sold (COGS) and ensure correct cost allocation to product categories.
	Collaborate with procurement, logistics, and sales teams to ensure accuracy of stock and sales data.
	Monitor product margins and profitability, advising management on pricing or cost-saving opportunities.


Accounts Payable &amp; Receivable Management:


	Supervise the processing of vendor invoices and ensure timely payments.
	Monitor customer accounts, ensuring prompt invoicing and collection of receivables.
	Maintain effective credit control systems to minimize bad debts
	Conduct regular reconciliations of customer and supplier accounts.
	Manage cash advances, staff reimbursements, and expense reporting.


Internal Control &amp; Team Management:


	Implement and maintain sound internal control systems to safeguard company assets.
	Review and approve financial transactions posted by junior accounting staff.
	Train and mentor accounting team members, ensuring adherence to company policies and standards.


Cash Flow &amp; Treasury Management:


	Monitor daily cash flow to ensure availability of funds for operations.
	Prepare cash flow forecasts and advise management on liquidity positions.
	Manage relationships with financial institutions and recommend investment or financing options&nbsp;when necessary.


Requirements or Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant accounting experience, preferably in a structured organization.
	Professional certification, such as ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent, is required.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles (IFRS, GAAP) and financial reporting standards.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, SAP, or similar).
	Excellent analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines.
	The ideal candidate should reside in Ikeja or its environs for ease of commute and prompt availability.


Salary
N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
